Package ji.common.structures

Interface ThrowingBiFunction<T,​R,​S,​E extends java.lang.Throwable>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the input to the function
    R - the type of the second argument to the function
    S - the type of the result of the function
    E - the type of expected child of Throwable
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
    @FunctionalInterface
public interface ThrowingBiFunction<T,​R,​S,​E extends java.lang.Throwable>
    Represents a function that accepts two arguments and produces a result. This is FunctionalInterface whose functional method is apply(Object, Object)

    Instead of result, apply(Object, Object) can throws Throwable

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      S apply​(T first, R second)
      Applies this function to the given arguments

    • Method Detail

      • apply

        R second)
 throws E extends java.lang.Throwable
        Applies this function to the given arguments. *
        Parameters:
        first - the first function argument
        second - the second function argument
        Returns:
        the function result
        Throws:
        E - expected Throwable
        E extends java.lang.Throwable
